numbered_ace_sentences: 1. A family has a money income.
2. If a family has a higher money income then a student from this family is more likely to be accepted into a college.
4. A student can be middle-class or lower-class.
5. A student can try very hard.
6. A student can fail to be accepted into a college because of the money income of the family.
7. I ask whether everyone has equal opportunity to education.
9. If a student is financially stable then this student has a higher chance of accessing higher education.
10. I wonder why this is the case.
12. In my community, we are applying to colleges now.
13. The question is: Is education really fair?
